page.title: 08HEALTH A Doctors Day
page.content: A doctor will start his day just before nine o'clock by doing a ward round which takes on average half an hour. He sees the patients in the {ward}to decide whether they are well enough to go home or whether they need futher treatment.After the ward round the doctor will go to{theatre}to operate on patients.After theatre he will go back to the ward to check the patient for the following day's operation,to be sure they are fit to undergo an operation.In the afternoon they see patients in the{"out patient" department.In the evening one doctor per department has to be "on call" for emergencies. A{ward}is a section of the hospital where patients stay. A{theatre}is a place where doctors operate on patient.{"Out patients"}are patients which stay at their homes.
